title: Getting started
text: spacedeconv unified interface 31 deconvolution tools focus spatial transcriptomics datasets. total 17 second-generation deconvolution tools included, enabling deconvolution cell types single-cell reference data available. Additionally 10 first-generation tools, focussing deconvolution immune cells, available well 4 first-generation methods optimised mouse data. methods don’t require scRNA-seq data perform deconvolution utilize precomputed verified signatures.

title: Getting started
text: two ways install spacedeconv: minimal installation installs dependencies required basic functionalities. deconvolution methods need installed -demand. complete installtation installs dependencies including deconvolution methods. may take considerable time. Since dependencies CRAN Bioconductor, spacedeconv available GitHub . recommend installing trough pak package manager:
code: # install the pak package manager install.packages("pak")  # recommended installation, deconvolution tools are installed on-demand pak::pkg_install("omnideconv/spacedeconv")  # full installation including all deconvolution tools pak::pkg_install("omnideconv/spacedeconv", dependencies = TRUE)

title: Getting started
text: spacedeconv offers convenient access perform first- second-generation deconvolution spatial transcriptomics datasets. deconvolution can performed directly first-generation methods, second-generation algorithms require additional annotated single-cell reference. SpatialExperiment, deconvoluted SingleCellExperiment (recommended), anndata Seurat containing cell type information can load 10X Visium Data providing spaceranger output folder. possible run spacedeconv manually created SpatialExperiments. See SpatialExperiment Documentation details.
code: spe <- SpatialExperiment::read10xVisium("path_to_directory")

title: Getting started
text: core modules spacedeconv used build reference signature deconvolute spatial transcriptomics data. provide convenient functions normalization visualization. full list deconvolution algorithms can accessed spacedeconv::deconvolution_methods FAQ.

title: Getting started
text: spacedeconv offers function normalize spatial expression data. normalization saved additional assay, make sure use correct data deconvolution providing desired assay parameters assay_sc assay_sp.
code: spe <- spacedeconv::normalize(spe, method = "cpm")  # specify expression assay to use signature <- spacedeconv::build_model(spe,   method = "quantiseq",   assay_sp = "cpm" )

title: Getting started
text: second-generation deconvolution tools require cell-type specific reference signature can calculated build_model() function. build signature annotated single-cell sequencing data required.
code: signature <- spacedeconv::build_model(   single_cell_object,   cell_type_col = "celltype_major",   method = "spotlight",   assay_sc = "cpm" )

title: Getting started
text: function deconvolutes spatial transcriptomics dataset using one spacedeconvs 31 deconvolution tools. Since first-generation deconvolution tools contain predefined expression signatures tools can used directly spatial data. need provide signature case. spacedeconv returns SpatialExperiment object annotated deconvolution results.
code: # save the results to an annotated SpatialExperiment result <- spacedeconv::deconvolute(   spatial_object,   signature,   method = "spotlight" )  # return deconvolution results in table form result <- spacedeconv::deconvolute(   spatial_object,   signature,   method = "spotlight",   return_object = FALSE )

title: Getting started
text: offer 6 visualization function aiming different insight data. full example visualization option available visualization Vignette.
code: # sample does refer to the first column of ColData(spe) # for cell_type input a celltype present in the deconvolution result spacedeconv::plot_celltype(spe, cell_type = "spotlight_B.cells")  # umi count spacedeconv::plot_umi_count(spe)

title: Ligand-Receptor Analysis
text: function provides framework infer Ligand-Receptor Interactions within sample using known L-R pairs. function extracts expression levels known L-R pairs gene expression matrix given spe object.

title: Ligand-Receptor Analysis
text: use spacedeconvs spatial data 3 analysis. always encourage user preprocess normalize data first, case, function also preprocess normalize data CPM internally, following step optional.
code: data("spatial_data_3")  # this step is optional spe <- spacedeconv::preprocess(spatial_data_3, remove_mito = TRUE) spe <- spacedeconv::normalize(spe, method = "cpm")

title: Ligand-Receptor Analysis
text: user can define reference table L-R pairs use default table, filtered selection intercell network, provided Omnipath (user can either leave resource argument empty input “Consensus” use default resource). case user-defined L-R table, contain following columns: source_symbol column containing ligands ligand complexes target_symbol column receptors receptor complexes. Complexes: function can also handle L R complexes. case, members complex split expressions extracted separately. one members either Ligand- Receptor- complex missing CPM expression matrix spe object L-R pair removed. Calculation scores L-R scores can calculated using two mathematical approaches, can defined using method argument. Either min values Ligand Receptors pair (deafult input “min”) product expression Ligand Receptor pair (input “product”) Organisms: function can also handle mouse data. user can input user-defined reference table L–R mouse pairs. user can convert human mouse L-R pairs convert_mouse_to_human function spacedeconv. user-defined table format mentioned . Otherwise default human reference table converted internally mouse data used calculate L-R scores. use default mouse table input “mouse” organism argument either leave resource parameter empty input “Consensus” calculation scores L-R pair stored ColData spe object marked “lr”. example Data used , human breast cancer slide use “min” mathematical approach default reference L-R table (“Consensus”).
code: spe <- spacedeconv::get_lr(spe,   resource = "Consensus",   method = "min",   organism = "human" )

title: Ligand-Receptor Analysis
text: results can visualized plot_celltype function spacedeconv.
code: spacedeconv::plot_celltype(spe,   cell_type = "lr_LGALS3.LAG3",   smooth = TRUE,   density = FALSE )  spacedeconv::plot_celltype(spe,   cell_type = "lr_CD274.PDCD1",   smooth = TRUE,   density = FALSE )

title: Data Input
text: spacedeconv integrates first- second-generation deconvolution algorithms transcriptome data. first-generation tools deconvolute based internal precomputed signatures, second-generation deconvolution tools compute cell type specific expression signatures annotated single-cell expression data. following requirements workflow details types data explained detail.

title: Data Input
text: spacedeconv contains 4 different spatial datasets obtained 10XVisium platform. Additionally 4 matching scRNA-seq datasets available can used calculate custom expression signatures. data can loaded like :
code: library(spacedeconv) data("single_cell_data_1") data("single_cell_data_2") data("single_cell_data_3") data("single_cell_data_4") data("spatial_data_1") data("spatial_data_2") data("spatial_data_3") data("spatial_data_4")

title: Data Input
text: build cell-type specific signatures second-generation deconvolution spacedeconv utilized annotated single-cell reference data. single cell data needs include cell-type annotations can one following formats: SingleCellExperiment (recommended) AnnData Seurat Cell type information needs available. can specify column containing annotation cell_type_col parameter. applies batch ID information required MuSiC, SCDC, BSeq-sc, CDSeq CARD parameter batch_id_col.
code: signature <- build_model(single_cell_data_1,   method = "dwls",   cell_type_col = "celltype_major", )  # some methods require batch_id information as well sigature <- build_model(single_cell_data_1,   method = "scdc",   cell_type_col = "celltype_major",   batch_id_col = "orig.ident" )

title: Data Input
text: Spatially resolved data needs available SpatialExperiment format. 10XVisium slides data can loaded easily providing path directory create SpaceRanger. information data loading manual object construction can found SpatialExperiment Vignette. Spatial data available Seurat Object can converted SpatialExperiment:
code: spe <- SpatialExperiment::read10xVisium(path_to_directory) spe <- seurat_to_spatialexperiment(seurat_object)

title: Data Input
text: SpaceDeconv offers additional function convenient normalization SpatialExperiments. normalization saved new assay, make sure correct data used deconvolution providing desired assay parameters assay_sc assay_sp. normalization method cpm logcpm available.
code: spe <- normalize(spe, method = "cpm")  # make sure to use cpm assay in deconvolution step deconvolution <- deconvolute(spe, method = "quantiseq", assay_sp = "cpm")

title: Data Input
text: case background image aligned properly SpatialExperiment class offers convenient functions rotation / mirroring: rotateImg(image, degrees) mirrorImg(image, axis) # 'h'/'v' Information available SpatialExperiment Documentation

title: Example
text: tutorial use one spacedeconvs sample dataset deconvolution algorithm “SCDC”.
code: data("single_cell_data_3") data("spatial_data_3")

title: Example
text: build model need provide single cell expression object annotated cell type information. Let’s look object see annotation available. three different resolutions cell type annotation available. tutorial choose "celltype_major" cell type annotation includes 9 different cell-types. Next can calculate signature using annotated single-data deconvolution tool “spatialDWLS”. signature contains expression values celltypes subset distinctly expressed genes. following example shows first 10 rows signature calculated previous step.
code: names(colData(single_cell_data_3)) #>  [1] "Sample"          "Barcode"         "orig.ident"      "nCount_RNA"      #>  [5] "nFeature_RNA"    "percent.mito"    "subtype"         "celltype_subset" #>  [9] "celltype_minor"  "celltype_major" signature <- spacedeconv::build_model(   single_cell_obj = single_cell_data_3,   cell_type_col = "celltype_major",   method = "dwls", verbose = TRUE, dwls_method = "mast_optimized", ncores = 10 ) knitr::kable(round(signature[1:10, ], 4))

title: Example
text: deconvolute Visium slide use signature just calculated. Depending selected deconvolution tool parameters need passed, case cell_type_col batch_id_col well scRNA-seq reference dataset.
code: deconv <- spacedeconv::deconvolute(   spatial_obj = spatial_data_3,   single_cell_obj = single_cell_data_3,   cell_type_col = "celltype_major",   method = "dwls",   signature = signature,   assay_sp = "cpm" )

what: My SpatialExperiment contains ENSEMBL IDs. Can i still perform deconvolution?
title: FAQ
text: possible perform second-generation deconvolution algorithms annotated scRNA-seq data containing ENSEMBL IDs available. first-gen deconvolution tools require HGNC symbols. may also check SpatialExperiment rowData() available annotation overwrite ENSEMBL IDs. cases can solved using following code:
code: rownames(spe) <- rowData(spe)$symbol

what: How can i see which deconvolution results are available in my object?
title: FAQ
text: can use available_results(object) access names(colData(object)) see deconvolution results available.

what: The spacedeconv plots contain a lot of white spots
title: FAQ
text: reading raw spatial data SpatialExperiment contains expression information spots, even located tissue. Remove spots following code
code: spe <- spe[, colData(spe)$in_tissue == TRUE]

what: The Visium Slide and the spatial data are not rotated in the same direction
title: FAQ
text: SpatialExperiment wrapper includes function rotate/mirror image. information can found Visualization Vignette SpatialExperiment Documentation.

what: The hexagons in my plots are rotated and don’t give an even appearance
title: FAQ
text: Visium slide might aligned incorrectly. Try rotating image use offset_rotation=TRUE parameter plotting function.

title: FAQ
text: list includes methods name internally used tokens. detailed descriptions method can found end vignette.
code: spacedeconv::deconvolution_methods ## → checking spacedeconv environment and dependencies ##             RCTD        SPOTlight             CARD      spatialDWLS  ##           "rctd"      "spotlight"           "card"    "spatialdwls"  ##    cell2location        AutoGeneS       BayesPrism           Bisque  ##  "cell2location"      "autogenes"     "bayesprism"         "bisque"  ##          BSeq-sc       CIBERSORTx            CDSeq              CPM  ##         "bseqsc"     "cibersortx"          "cdseq"            "cpm"  ##             DWLS             MOMF            MuSiC           Scaden  ##           "dwls"           "momf"          "music"         "scaden"  ##             SCDC       MCPcounter             EPIC        quanTIseq  ##           "scdc"    "mcp_counter"           "epic"      "quantiseq"  ##            xCell        CIBERSORT CIBERSORT (abs.) title: Workflow Utilities
text: function can used preprocess single-cell spatial datasets. cuts low high UMI observations, removes noisy expression performs additional checks streamline deconvolution analysis. functions takes SingleCellExperiment, AnnData Seurat returns processed SingleCellExperiment. min_umi max_umi parameters can set improve data quality. assay can selected assay parameter. Additionally Mitochondria Genes can removed setting remove_mito=TRUE.
code: data("single_cell_data_3") sce <- spacedeconv::preprocess(single_cell_data_3, min_umi = 500, assay = "counts", remove_mito = TRUE) ## ── spacedeconv ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## ℹ testing parameter ## ✔ parameter OK [65ms] ##  ## ℹ Removing 8 observations with umi count below threshold ## ✔ Removed 8 observations with umi count below threshold [694ms] ##  ## ℹ Removing 5862 variables with all zero expression ## ✔ Removed 5862 variables with all zero expression [689ms] ##  ## ℹ Removing 13 mitochondria genes ## ✔ Removed 13 mitochondria genes [656ms] ##  ## ℹ Removing duplicated genes ## ✔ Removed duplicated genes [50ms] ##  ## ℹ Checking for ENSEMBL Identifiers ## ! Warning: ENSEMBL identifiers detected in gene names ## ℹ Checking for ENSEMBL Identifiersℹ Consider using Gene Names for first-generation deconvolution tools ## ℹ Checking for ENSEMBL Identifiers✔ Finished Preprocessing [6ms]

title: Workflow Utilities
text: function helps adding custom annotation vector SpatialExperiment object.
code: # newAnnotation is a vector containing custom annotation for each spot spe <- addCustomAnnotation(spe, columnName = "ManualAnnotation", values = new_annotation)

title: Workflow Utilities
text: function able annotate spots TRUE / FALSE want classify specific subgroup spots. takes list spots classified TRUE, setting spots FALSE.
code: # spots is a list of spot names. spe <- annotate_spots(spe, spots, value_pos = TRUE, value_neg = FALSE, name = "customAnnotation")

title: Workflow Utilities
text: deconvolution tools compute relative cell fractions spots. cell counts spot can scale relative values absolute cell counts using function. input parameters column name scaled value vector absolute cell counts spot cell_counts. can also set new resName.
code: # cell_counts_per_spot contains spot level absolute cell counts spe_absolute <- scale_cell_counts(spe, value = "dwls_B.cells", cell_counts = cell_counts_per_spot, resName = "BCellsAbsolute")

title: Workflow Utilities
text: improve resource requirements deconvolution computation can reduce input scRNA-seq reference size subsetting. functions requires input sce object, column name containing cell-type annotation cell_type_col. can specify subsetting scenario scenario one “mirror” “even”. mirror scenario keeps cell-type proportions input data reduces overall cell number. even scenario selects number cells cell-type. Specify number cells want subsetting using ncells parameter. case notEnoughcells available cell-type match required number according scenario can set parameter “asis” keep remaining cells “remove” cell-type completely.
code: subset <- subsetSCE(sce, cell_type_col = "celltype_major", scenario = "mirror", ncells = 500) ## ── spacedeconv ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## ℹ testing parameter ## ℹ Set seed to 12345 ## ℹ testing parameter✔ parameter OK [11ms] ##  ## ℹ extracting up to 500 cells ## ✔ extracting up to 500 cells [99ms] ##  ## ℹ extracted 501 cells ## ✔ extracted 501 cells [10ms]

title: Workflow Utilities
text: working full Spatial data can opt using subset spatial slide. function take colRange rowRange vector containing pixel coordinates fullres image cut subsets provided spatial data.
code: subset <- subsetSPE(spe, colRange = c(0, 1000), rowRange = c(0, 1000))

title: Visualization
text: plot_celltype() visualizes spatial image color coded cell type fractions one cell type. plot_gene() plot spatial gene expression. plot_umi_count() Plots number sequenced reads per spot. plot_most_abundant() Render plot containing abundant cell-type spot. plot_comparison() Plot comparison two cell-type fractions.

title: Visualization
text: Plot spot annotation continuous discrete scale. spot annotation needs colData(spe), manual annotation can added SpatialExperiment object visualization.
code: spacedeconv::plot_celltype(deconv, cell_type = "dwls_B.cells", density = F, smooth = T, title = "B cells")

title: Visualization
text: Plot gene expression spatial level. may make sense smooth plot simplify detection expression patterns. can select assay using assay parameter.
code: spacedeconv::plot_gene(deconv, gene = "CD19", density = F, smooth = T, title = "CD19 expression")

title: Visualization
text: plot shows number detected UMIs spot. recommend rendering plot transform_scale = "sqrt" due large range UMI count values.
code: spacedeconv::plot_umi_count(deconv, transform_scale = "sqrt", density = F, smooth = T, title_size = "UMI count") ## Warning in numnotnull("fontsize"): NAs introduced by coercion

title: Visualization
text: plots displays abundant cell-type spot. can specify cells plot either one following: cell_type vector celltypes plot method plotting cell types provided method remove vector celltypes removed plot
code: spacedeconv::plot_most_abundant(deconv,   method = "dwls",   density = F,   title_size = 25,   legend_size = 15,   font_size = 10,   remove = c("dwls_Cancer.Epithelial", "dwls_CAFs") )

title: Visualization
text: Use function plot ratio deconvolution results two cell-types.
code: spacedeconv::plot_comparison(deconv,   cell_type_1 = "dwls_Cancer.Epithelial", # red   cell_type_2 = "dwls_Normal.Epithelial", # blue   palette = "Blue-Red",   density = F,   smooth = T,   title = "Cancer vs. Normal Epithelial" )

title: Visualization
text: palettes colorspace R Package can used.
code: colorspace::hcl_palettes(plot = TRUE)

title: Visualization
text: spacedeconvs Visualization function designed work data SpaceRanger >= V2.0. Since Version image rotated default hourglass fiducial upper left corner. Previous SpaceRanger results can rotated differently. rotation additionally reflects angle spots slide. Uncorrectly rotated images result hexagons rotated 30 degrees. compensate can use offset_rotation parameter correct hexagon alignment. necessary Visium slides hourglass fiducial bottom left upper right corner.
code: plot_umi_count(deconv, offset_rotation = T) # rotate hexagons

title: Visualization
text: transform_scale parameter colorspace scale can modified. Available options : “ln”, “log10”, “log2” “sqrt”. Scaling color range differently can aid interpreting plot. Please mind plot show valid deconvolution results anymore handled caution.
code: spacedeconv::plot_umi_count(deconv, transform_scale = "sqrt", density = FALSE)

title: Visualization
text: parameter expression values can smoothed simplify pattern recognition. smoother utilizes linear kernel size calculated multiplying spot distance smoothing factor. mentioned operation changes deconvolution result final plots appling kernel, interpreted helpful visualization option deconvolution result. smooth=T enable smoothing smoothing_factor choose kernel size (factor spot distance)
code: spacedeconv::plot_celltype(deconv,   cell_type = "dwls_B.cells",   smooth = T,   smoothing_factor = 1.5,   density = FALSE )

title: Visualization
text: can add density distribution setting density = TRUE. red line corresponds mean distribution.
code: spacedeconv::plot_celltype(deconv,   cell_type = "dwls_B.cells",   smooth = TRUE,   density = TRUE,   title_size = 20,   legend_size = 15,   font_size = 10,   title = "B cells smoothed" )

title: Visualization
text: can save plot setting save=TRUE. Specify file path path parameter. path provided plots stored ~/spacedeconvResults/. change size rendered plot use png_width png_height set plot size pixels. Plots saved png.
code: spacedeconv::plot_celltype(deconv,   cell_type = "quantiseq_B.cell",   smooth = TRUE,   density = TRUE,   save = TRUE,   path = "~/project/results",   png_width = 1000,   png_height = 750 )

title: Cluster spacedeconv results — cluster
text: spe SpatialExperiment object containing data clustered. method character vector specifying clustering method use. Options "kmeans" "hclust". Default c("kmeans", "hclust"). spmethod character vector indicating type analysis clustering. Options include "expression", "progeny", "dorothea", "collectri", names deconvolution methods. Default based available deconvolution methods. dist_method character vector specifying distance measure used "hclust" method. Options include "correlation", "euclidean", "maximum", "manhattan", "canberra", "binary", "minkowski". hclust_method character vector indicating agglomeration method used "hclust". Options include "complete", "ward.D", "ward.D2", "single", "average", "mcquitty", "median", "centroid". nclusters integer specifying number clusters create. Default 3. pca_dim integer vector specifying PCA dimensions used clustering expression data. used Seurat::FindNeighbors. Default seq(1, 30). clusres numeric value clustering resolution used Seurat::FindClusters. Default 0.5. ... Additional parameters clustering methods.

Choose "circle", "square", "ellipse", "number", "shade", "color", "pie" insig 'blank', wipe away corresponding glyphs; 'p-value', add p-values corresponding glyphs; 'pch', add characters (see pch details) corresponding glyphs; 'n', take measures; 'label_sig' (default), mark significant correlations pch (see sig.level). addCoef.col add labels plot showing correlation values, default NULL, user can choose color add color values. ... additional parameters passed corrplot function

text: function facilitates subsetting SingleCellExperiment object specified number cells, option maintain even proportional distribution across different cell types. offers flexibility handling scenarios insufficient cells specific type available ensures reproducibility option set seed random sampling.

title: Subset a SingleCellExperiment by Cell Type — subsetSCE
code: subsetSCE(   sce,   cell_type_col = "celltype_major",   scenario = "even",   ncells = 1000,   notEnough = "asis",   seed = 12345 )

title: Subset a SingleCellExperiment by Cell Type — subsetSCE
text: sce SingleCellExperiment object containing cell type annotations. function applies subsetting operations object achieve targeted composition cell types. cell_type_col character string indicating column name within colData SingleCellExperiment object contains cell type information. column used identify categorize cells type subsetting. scenario Specifies strategy cell selection across types: "even" equal numbers cell type, "mirror" reflect proportional representation cell types subset original dataset. ncells target total number cells subsetted object. Defaults 1000. parameter dictates overall size subsetted SingleCellExperiment. notEnough Defines behavior enough cells certain type meet subsetting criteria: "remove" exclude cell type entirely, "asis" include available cells type despite falling short target number. seed optional numeric value set random seed reproducibility subsetting process. ensures subset selection can replicated future analyses.

title: Subset a SingleCellExperiment by Cell Type — subsetSCE
text: Returns subsetted SingleCellExperiment object. resulting object reflects targeted distribution number cells specified input parameters. enables focused analysis manageable dataset preserving desired representation cell types.
